intro: Lisianthius elegans, commonly known as the elegant lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to deep purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or biennial, reaching heights of up to 30 inches, with lance-shaped leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers bloom in clusters at the top of the stems, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. The plant prefers well-drained soil and full sun, thriving in temperate climates.
